Generate a Basic Report on Data Revisions

generate_basic_report.Rd

This function creates a basic PDF report summarizing data revisions. The report includes a title, author(s), and optionally a logo. It uses a customizable R Markdown template and requires the reviser package's built-in templates.

Usage

generate_basic_report(
  data,
  output_file = "report.pdf",
  title = "Title of my basic report on data revisions",
  author = "Author(s)",
  include_logo = TRUE,
  logo_path = NULL,
  template_file = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data frame or tibble. The input dataset to be included in the report.

output_file

A string. The name of the output file. Defaults to "report.pdf".

title

A string. The title of the report. Defaults to "Title of my basic report on data revisions".

author

A string. The name(s) of the author(s) of the report. Defaults to "Author(s)".

include_logo

A logical. If TRUE, a logo is included in the report. Defaults to TRUE.

logo_path

A string. The file path to the logo image. If NULL, a default logo provided by the reviser package is used. Ignored if include_logo = FALSE.

template_file

A string. The file path to a custom LaTeX template for the report. If NULL, the default template provided by the reviser package is used.

Value

A message indicating the location of the generated report.

Details

  • Logo Handling: If include_logo is TRUE and no logo_path is provided, a default logo from the package templates is used.

  • Template Handling: If a template_file is provided, it is used for generating the report; otherwise, the default template is used.

The report is rendered using rmarkdown::render() with the pdf_document output format and the xelatex LaTeX engine.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example usage with default options:
generate_basic_report(data = my_data)

# Example with custom options:
generate_basic_report(
  data = my_data,
  output_file = "custom_report.pdf",
  title = "Custom Report Title",
  author = "John Doe",
  include_logo = TRUE,
  logo_path = "path/to/logo.png",
  template_file = "path/to/template.tex"
)
} # }
